definitions.definition: a large amount or to a large degree:
a far larger amount of something than you want or need:
examples: You've drunk much too much to drive.

definitions.definition: more than someone can deal with:
examples: I can't take care of six children at my age - it's too much.
I think it's a bit much for you to expect me to do all the cleaning.

definitions.definition: used at the end of a sentence to emphasize what you have just said:
examples: When he saw all the food on my plate, he said "Hungry much?"
He's not much to look at, but he has a wonderful personality.
